trans-unit.source: Line of business application Phase 5 | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Line of business application Phase 5 | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Create an availability group and add your application databases to it in Phase 5 of the line of business application in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Create an availability group and add your application databases to it in Phase 5 of the line of business application in Azure.

trans-unit.source: In this final phase of deploying a high-availability line of business application in Azure infrastructure services, you create a new SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Group and add the databases of the application.
trans-unit.target: In this final phase of deploying a high-availability line of business application in Azure infrastructure services, you create a new SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Group and add the databases of the application.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Deploy a high-availability line of business application in Azure</linkText><title></title> for all of the phases.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Deploy a high-availability line of business application in Azure</linkText><title></title> for all of the phases.

trans-unit.source: For each database of the line of business application:
trans-unit.target: For each database of the line of business application:

trans-unit.source: Take a full backup and a transaction log backup of the database on the primary SQL Server virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Take a full backup and a transaction log backup of the database on the primary SQL Server virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Restore the full and log backups on the backup SQL Server virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Restore the full and log backups on the backup SQL Server virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Once the databases have been both backed up and restored, they can be added to the availability group.
trans-unit.target: Once the databases have been both backed up and restored, they can be added to the availability group.

trans-unit.source: SQL Server only allows databases that have been backed up (at least once), and restored on another machine, to be in the group.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server only allows databases that have been backed up (at least once), and restored on another machine, to be in the group.

trans-unit.source: To enable backup and restore, the backup files (.bak) must be accessible from the secondary database server.
trans-unit.target: To enable backup and restore, the backup files (.bak) must be accessible from the secondary database server.

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure:
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure:

trans-unit.source: Log on to the primary database server as [domain]\sqladmin.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the primary database server as [domain]\sqladmin.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the F:\ disk.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the F:\ disk.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the Backup folder and click Share with and click specific people.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the Backup folder and click Share with and click specific people.

trans-unit.source: In the File sharing dialog, type [domain]\sqlservice, and then click Add.
trans-unit.target: In the File sharing dialog, type [domain]\sqlservice, and then click Add.

trans-unit.source: Click the Permission Level column for the sqlservice account name, and then click Read/Write.
trans-unit.target: Click the Permission Level column for the sqlservice account name, and then click Read/Write.

trans-unit.source: Click Share, and then click Done.
trans-unit.target: Click Share, and then click Done.

trans-unit.source: Perform the above procedure on the secondary database server, except give the sqlservice account Read permission for the F:\Backup folder in step 5.
trans-unit.target: Perform the above procedure on the secondary database server, except give the sqlservice account Read permission for the F:\Backup folder in step 5.

trans-unit.source: The following procedures must be repeated for every database that needs to be added to the availability group.
trans-unit.target: The following procedures must be repeated for every database that needs to be added to the availability group.

trans-unit.source: Use these steps to back up a database.
trans-unit.target: Use these steps to back up a database.

trans-unit.source: From the Start screen of the primary database server, type SQL Studio, and then click SQL Server Management Studio.
trans-unit.target: From the Start screen of the primary database server, type SQL Studio, and then click SQL Server Management Studio.

trans-unit.source: Click Connect.
trans-unit.target: Click Connect.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, expand the Databases node.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, expand the Databases node.

trans-unit.source: Right-click a database to back up, point to Tasks, and then click Back up.
trans-unit.target: Right-click a database to back up, point to Tasks, and then click Back up.

trans-unit.source: In the Destination section, click Remove to remove the default file path for the backup file.
trans-unit.target: In the Destination section, click Remove to remove the default file path for the backup file.

trans-unit.source: Click Add.
trans-unit.target: Click Add.

trans-unit.source: In File name, type \\[machineName]\backup\[databaseName].bak, where machineName is the name of the primary SQL server computer and databaseName is the name of the database.
trans-unit.target: In File name, type \\[machineName]\backup\[databaseName].bak, where machineName is the name of the primary SQL server computer and databaseName is the name of the database.

trans-unit.source: Click OK, and then click OK again after the message about the successful backup.
trans-unit.target: Click OK, and then click OK again after the message about the successful backup.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, right-click [databaseName], point to Tasks, and then click Back Up.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, right-click [databaseName], point to Tasks, and then click Back Up.

trans-unit.source: In Backup type, select Transaction Log, and then click OK twice.
trans-unit.target: In Backup type, select Transaction Log, and then click OK twice.

trans-unit.source: Keep this remote desktop session open.
trans-unit.target: Keep this remote desktop session open.

trans-unit.source: Use these steps to restore a database.
trans-unit.target: Use these steps to restore a database.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the secondary database server as [domainName]\spfarmdb.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the secondary database server as [domainName]\spfarmdb.

trans-unit.source: From the Start screen, type SQL Studio, and then click SQL Server Management Studio.
trans-unit.target: From the Start screen, type SQL Studio, and then click SQL Server Management Studio.

trans-unit.source: Click Connect.
trans-unit.target: Click Connect.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, right-click Databases, and then click Restore Database.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, right-click Databases, and then click Restore Database.

trans-unit.source: In the Source section, select Device, and click the ellipses (…)
trans-unit.target: In the Source section, select Device, and click the ellipses (…)

trans-unit.source: button
trans-unit.target: button

trans-unit.source: In Select backup devices, click Add.
trans-unit.target: In Select backup devices, click Add.

trans-unit.source: In Backup file location, type \\[machineName]\backup, press Enter, select [databaseName].bak, and then click OK twice.
trans-unit.target: In Backup file location, type \\[machineName]\backup, press Enter, select [databaseName].bak, and then click OK twice.

trans-unit.source: You should now see the full backup and the log backup in the Backup sets to restore section.
trans-unit.target: You should now see the full backup and the log backup in the Backup sets to restore section.

trans-unit.source: Under Select a page, click Options.
trans-unit.target: Under Select a page, click Options.

trans-unit.source: In the Restore options section, in Recovery state, select RESTORE WITH NORECOVERY, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: In the Restore options section, in Recovery state, select RESTORE WITH NORECOVERY, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: Click OK when prompted.
trans-unit.target: Click OK when prompted.

trans-unit.source: After at least one database is prepared (using the backup and restore method), you create an Availability Group.
trans-unit.target: After at least one database is prepared (using the backup and restore method), you create an Availability Group.

trans-unit.source: Return to the remote desktop session for the primary database server.
trans-unit.target: Return to the remote desktop session for the primary database server.

trans-unit.source: In SQL Server Management Studio, in the left pane, right-click AlwaysOn High Availability, and then click New Availability Group Wizard.
trans-unit.target: In SQL Server Management Studio, in the left pane, right-click AlwaysOn High Availability, and then click New Availability Group Wizard.

trans-unit.source: On the Introduction page, click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Introduction page, click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Specify Availability Group Name page, type the name of your availability group in Availability group name (example: AG1), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Specify Availability Group Name page, type the name of your availability group in Availability group name (example: AG1), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Select Databases page, select the databases for the application that were backed up, and click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Select Databases page, select the databases for the application that were backed up, and click Next.

trans-unit.source: These databases meet the prerequisites for an availability group because you have taken at least one full backup on the intended primary replica.
trans-unit.target: These databases meet the prerequisites for an availability group because you have taken at least one full backup on the intended primary replica.

trans-unit.source: On the Specify Replicas page, click Add Replica.
trans-unit.target: On the Specify Replicas page, click Add Replica.

trans-unit.source: In Connect to Server, type the name of the secondary database server, and then click Connect.
trans-unit.target: In Connect to Server, type the name of the secondary database server, and then click Connect.

trans-unit.source: On the Specify Replicas page, the secondary database server is listed in Availability Replicas.
trans-unit.target: On the Specify Replicas page, the secondary database server is listed in Availability Replicas.

trans-unit.source: For both instances, set the following option values:
trans-unit.target: For both instances, set the following option values:

trans-unit.source: Initial Role
trans-unit.target: Initial Role

trans-unit.source: Option
trans-unit.target: Option

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Primary
trans-unit.target: Primary

trans-unit.source: Automatic Failover (Up to 2)
trans-unit.target: Automatic Failover (Up to 2)

trans-unit.source: Selected
trans-unit.target: Selected

trans-unit.source: Secondary
trans-unit.target: Secondary

trans-unit.source: Automatic Failover (Up to 2)
trans-unit.target: Automatic Failover (Up to 2)

trans-unit.source: Selected
trans-unit.target: Selected

trans-unit.source: Primary
trans-unit.target: Primary

trans-unit.source: Synchronous Commit (Up to 3)
trans-unit.target: Synchronous Commit (Up to 3)

trans-unit.source: Selected
trans-unit.target: Selected

trans-unit.source: Secondary
trans-unit.target: Secondary

trans-unit.source: Synchronous Commit (Up to 3)
trans-unit.target: Synchronous Commit (Up to 3)

trans-unit.source: Selected
trans-unit.target: Selected

trans-unit.source: Primary
trans-unit.target: Primary

trans-unit.source: Readable Secondary
trans-unit.target: Readable Secondary

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Secondary
trans-unit.target: Secondary

trans-unit.source: Readable Secondary
trans-unit.target: Readable Secondary

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Select Initial Data Synchronization page, click Join only, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Select Initial Data Synchronization page, click Join only, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: Data synchronization is executed manually by taking the full and transaction backups on the primary server, and restoring it on the backup.
trans-unit.target: Data synchronization is executed manually by taking the full and transaction backups on the primary server, and restoring it on the backup.

trans-unit.source: You can instead choose to select Full to let the New Availability Group Wizard perform data synchronization for you.
trans-unit.target: You can instead choose to select Full to let the New Availability Group Wizard perform data synchronization for you.

trans-unit.source: However, synchronization is not recommended for large databases that are found in some enterprises.
trans-unit.target: However, synchronization is not recommended for large databases that are found in some enterprises.

trans-unit.source: On the Validation page, click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Validation page, click Next.

trans-unit.source: There is a warning for a missing listener configuration because an availability group listener is not configured.
trans-unit.target: There is a warning for a missing listener configuration because an availability group listener is not configured.

trans-unit.source: On the Summary page, click Finish.
trans-unit.target: On the Summary page, click Finish.

trans-unit.source: Once the wizard is finished, inspect the Results page to verify that the availability group is successfully created.
trans-unit.target: Once the wizard is finished, inspect the Results page to verify that the availability group is successfully created.

trans-unit.source: If so, click Close to exit the wizard.
trans-unit.target: If so, click Close to exit the wizard.

trans-unit.source: From the Start screen, type Failover, and then click Failover Cluster Manager.
trans-unit.target: From the Start screen, type Failover, and then click Failover Cluster Manager.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, open the name of your cluster, and then click Roles.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, open the name of your cluster, and then click Roles.

trans-unit.source: A new role with the name of your availability group should be present.
trans-unit.target: A new role with the name of your availability group should be present.

trans-unit.source: You have successfully configured a SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Group for your application databases.
trans-unit.target: You have successfully configured a SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Group for your application databases.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to begin rolling out this new application to your intranet users.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to begin rolling out this new application to your intranet users.

trans-unit.source: You can optionally create a listener configuration for the AlwaysOn Availability Group.
trans-unit.target: You can optionally create a listener configuration for the AlwaysOn Availability Group.

trans-unit.source: For the steps, see <linkText>Tutorial: Listener Configuration for AlwaysOn Availability Groups</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For the steps, see <linkText>Tutorial: Listener Configuration for AlwaysOn Availability Groups</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: These instructions step you through creating only a single listener (recommended) and to use a static IP address of an internal load balancing instance.
trans-unit.target: These instructions step you through creating only a single listener (recommended) and to use a static IP address of an internal load balancing instance.

trans-unit.source: Once the listener is configured, you need to configure all the web server virtual machines to use the listener, instead of the name of the first SQL server in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Once the listener is configured, you need to configure all the web server virtual machines to use the listener, instead of the name of the first SQL server in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Rather than using a new DNS name and record that maps to the virtual IP address of the internal load balancing instance, configure the web server virtual machines to use a SQL Alias.
trans-unit.target: Rather than using a new DNS name and record that maps to the virtual IP address of the internal load balancing instance, configure the web server virtual machines to use a SQL Alias.

trans-unit.source: For details and steps, see <linkText>SQL Alias for SharePoint</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For details and steps, see <linkText>SQL Alias for SharePoint</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Deploy a high-availability line of business application in Azure</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Line of Business Applications architecture blueprint</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set up a web-based LOB application in a hybrid cloud for testing</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure infrastructure services implementation guidelines</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Infrastructure Services Workload: SharePoint Server 2013 farm</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Infrastructure Services Workload: SharePoint Server 2013 farm</linkText><title></title>
